author: axic3354
content:
While we were talking about the withdrawn status and rewritten EIPs, I see <@!683653554631868440> that you worked quite significantly on EIP-2315.

I wonder if it would actually be nicer to roll back 2315 to its version in Berlin, and start a new EIP with your new version?

My main reasoning is that 2315 was part of a hard fork and implementations of it exists, therefore this rewrite can cause significant confusion. You need to make it clear to the client devs that they need to start implementation from scratch and shouldn't rely on any of the existing code, otherwise you'll face a lot of potential consensus issues.
